impact_weight: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can lead to increased costs for farmers and food producers, which could impact food prices and, in turn, food security.
The implementation of GHG reduction targets may require changes in agricultural practices, potentially reducing the use of pesticides and promoting more sustainable farming methods.
Improving energy efficiency in buildings can enable the adoption of more sustainable food systems by reducing energy consumption and promoting eco-friendly practices.
The renovation of buildings to improve energy efficiency can increase costs for low-income households, potentially affecting their ability to afford sustainable food options.

The development of renewable energy can reinforce the competitiveness of the agricultural sector by providing sustainable and reliable energy sources, reducing costs, and promoting eco-friendly practices.
The production of renewable hydrogen can enable the development of sustainable food systems by providing a clean energy source for food production, processing, and transportation.
Ensuring access to affordable and sustainable energy can enable low-income households to afford nutritious food, improving their overall well-being and food security.
The adoption of solar energy can enable the development of sustainable agriculture practices, promoting animal welfare and reducing the environmental impact of farming.
